decks.notes: This deck focuses on using lands as both resources and win conditions, utilizing cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create powerful token creatures. It also includes disruptive elements like Wasteland and Boseiju, Who Endures to control the game and protect its game plan. Life from the Loam provides consistency and recursion while cards like Mox Diamond and Exploration help ramp up mana quickly. Overall, the deck aims to lock down the opponent's resources while assembling its own powerful land-based combos for victory.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively play Eldrazi creatures and use powerful Eldrazi spells to disrupt and overwhelm the opponent quickly. By utilizing cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer to control the game, while also playing high-impact threats like Reality Smasher and It That Heralds the End, this deck aims to close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The mana base is optimized for casting Eldrazi creatures quickly and efficiently, allowing the deck to consistently apply pressure and push for victories in the Legacy format.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck in Legacy 1 vs 1 format is to constantly apply pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent while disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Daze and Force of Will. The deck also aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat, while utilizing the card selection provided by cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure a consistent stream of threats. Additionally, the deck includes utility lands like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The main focus of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while controlling the tempo of the game. By using a combination of counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation, along with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, the deck aims to maintain control of the board. The deck also utilizes card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Stock Up to dig for crucial cards, while efficient threats like Katara, Waterbending Master and Murktide Regent apply pressure on the opponent. The mana base is optimized for consistency and utility with fetch lands and dual lands.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Cloudpost ramp engine to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing for the casting of powerful spells and creatures such as Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Force of Will to control the opponent's game plan. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and win the game before they can mount a defense.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up to play powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. By utilizing Eldrazi Temple and other mana sources, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats like Reality Smasher and It That Heralds the End. The inclusion of cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb allows for explosive plays and early aggression, making this deck a formidable force in the Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this Combo - Reanimator deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures such as Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. This deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect your combo pieces and disrupt your opponent's strategy. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student can help dig for combo pieces while cards like Bitter Triumph and Tainted Indulgence provide additional value. The deck aims to quickly reanimate big threats and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to respond effectively.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on using low-cost spells like Lightning Bolt and Daze to control the pace of the game while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Mishra's Bauble and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide card advantage and additional value, while cards like Brazen Borrower and Unholy Heat offer versatility in dealing with threats. The deck aims to be proactive, aggressive, and disruptive in order to secure victories quickly.

This Death & Taxes deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures. The deck utilizes Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play, along with disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Skyclave Apparition to slow down the opponent. Stoneforge Mystic is used to find equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice to further increase the deck's aggression. Overall, the deck aims to out-value the opponent through disruptive interactions and powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and disruptive cards like Wasteland and Back to Basics. Stoneforge Mystic is a key piece for finding equipment like Meteor Sword and Kaldra Compleat to gain advantage. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and control, while Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd offers protection and resilience. Quantum Riddler can provide additional card selection and deck manipulation. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents by carefully managing resources and disrupting their game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures or spells, then using Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield. It also uses counter magic like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its combo pieces. Cards like Thoughtseize help to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Bitter Triumph provides additional card draw. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Murktide Regent while controlling the board with Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It also utilizes land disruption with cards like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The deck focuses on cheating powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with these giant threats and close out the game quickly before the opponent has a chance to respond. The deck also includes ways to protect its game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm, while also manipulating its draws with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. The main goal is to establish a dominating board presence and win the game through explosive combos.

The deck focuses on using Doomsday as the central combo piece to set up a win condition by stacking the top of the library with Thassa's Oracle and quickly drawing it to win the game. It uses synergies and protection spells like Force of Will and Daze to ensure the combo goes off smoothly and efficiently. The deck also includes cards like Dark Ritual, Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, and Murktide Regent to provide additional utility and ways to advance the game plan. The overall strategy revolves around efficiently executing the Doomsday combo to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble a combo that allows the player to win the game in a single turn. By casting spells like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal, the player can ramp up their mana to play cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer, milling their entire deck into the graveyard. This triggers effects like Thassa's Oracle or Bridge from Below to secure victory. The inclusion of cards like Pact of Negation and Cabal Therapy provide protection and disruption against opponents while also enabling the combo.

This UWx Control deck is focused on disrupting the opponent's game plan while gaining card advantage and controlling the board. The deck includes a variety of removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending, along with counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to stop key threats. The deck also includes card draw and selection with Brainstorm and Ponder, as well as Planeswalkers like Narset, Parter of Veils and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to generate value. Additionally, the deck can lock down opponents with cards like Back to Basics and Magus of the Moon to disrupt their mana base.

This Bant Control deck focuses on card advantage, disruption, and ramping into powerful threats. Utilizing counterspells like Force of Will and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the game, while cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provide card advantage and resilience. Lrien Revealed and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help with card selection and digging through the deck. Sword to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending deal with threats efficiently. Life from the Loam allows for graveyard recursion and consistency. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents while eventually overwhelming them with powerful threats.
